sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It is Monday, the 22nd of August. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian authorities are investigating the car bomb that killed the daughter of a prominent ultra-nationalist political analyst.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kiev has dismissed all allegations that it was involved in the murder.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky warns of increased Russian attacks this week as Ukraine marks six months since Russia's invasion of the country and 31 years since it declared independence from the former Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic warns that Belgrade will intervene directly if NATO peacekeepers don't protect Serbs living in Kosovo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No peacekeepers don't protect Serbs living in Kosovo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Moscow have launched an investigation after the daughter of Russian ultra-nationalist ideologue Alexander Dugin was killed in a suspected car bomb attack outside the capital on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Investigators say an explosive device was planted in the SUVv driven by daria dugina no one has claimed responsibility for the attack but a russian political analyst and former speechwriter for president putin suggests it's linked to the war in ukraine for the propaganda apparatus this is an act of intimidation in general for loyalists for a border, this is a symbolic act demonstrating that hostilities are confidently transferred to the territory of Russia, which means that this is no longer an abstract war that you watch on TV. This is already happening in Russia. Not only Crimea is being bombed, but terrorist attacks are already being carried out in Moscow region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kiev has strongly denied any involvement. Alexander Dugin is a fierce champion of Russia's authoritarian leadership and is a vocal supporter of Moscow's war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: His daughter was also a strong critic of the West and was sanctioned by the United States in March for writing that Ukraine would perish if it joined NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: would perish if it joined NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is preparing to celebrate its independence from the USSR in 1991 on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This year, the date also marks exactly six months since Moscow invaded the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Kiev fears Russia could step up airstrikes this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky has warned that Russia may be preparing to put Ukrainian fighters captured in Mariupol on public trial to coincide with the anniversary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If this despicable trial takes place, if our people are brought into these settings in violation of all agreements, all international rules, there will be a reaction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This will be the line beyond which no negotiations are possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia will cut itself off from the negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There will be no more conversations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Our state has said everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Western leaders on Sunday called for restraint around Ukraine's Zaporizhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest, which has been occupied by the Russian army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Fighting around the plant has raised fears of a nuclear disaster worse than Chernobyl.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said sanctions against Russia will continue until peace in Ukraine is restored.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Russian government has to understand that they will not get rid of the sanctions simply by waiting until circumstances change again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That is only possible in the context of a fair agreement with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And so a peaceful situation will come about when Putin, when the Russian state, is prepared to accept this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Activists stormed the open doors event at the German Chancellery in Berlin, demanding an embargo on Russian gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Two activists with writing on their body, caught on camera next to Scholz, were apprehended by security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is preparing to celebrate its Independence Day on August 24th, the same day that marks six months since the beginning of Russia's full-scale invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In contrast with the usual military parades, this year Kyiv will be exhibiting destroyed Russian military equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In his late-night address on Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that Russia might take the opportunity to launch a brutal attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We should be aware that Russia may try to do something particularly disgusting and particularly violent this week, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's our enemy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia has done something disgusting and violent every week during the last six months, constantly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However the president also said the occupation of Crimea is temporary and that Ukraine is returning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: His message follows an alleged drone attack on the headquarters for Moscow's Black Sea fleet in Sevastopol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the Russian-appointed governor claims the drone was shot down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic has warned NATO that it must protect the Serbian minority in Kosovo or Belgrade will move to do it itself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: NATO peacekeepers were deployed in Kosovo last week after the collapse of EU-mediated talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Vucic says it aimed at pushing Serbs out of Kosovo, something he says he won't allow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There will be no refugee columns. Serbs out of Kosovo, something he says he won't allow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There will be no refugee columns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we will save our people from persecution and pogroms if NATO doesn't want to do it, if KFOR forces don't want to do it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This comes as EU foreign policy chief Joseph Bor√© hosted mediated talks between the leaders of Serbia and Kosovo last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tensions have been rising between the Balkan neighbours since Pristina declared last month that Serbian identity documents and vehicle licence plates would no longer be valid in Kosovo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Vucic also claims Albanian gangs are spilling into northern Kosovo, where most Kosovo Serbs live and need to be stopped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: northern Kosovo where most Kosovo Serbs live and need to be stopped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Serbia, along with its allies Russia and China, has refused to recognise Kosovo's 2008 declaration of independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Britain's biggest container port, Felixstowe, has been brought to a standstill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some 2,000 workers began an eight-day strike on Sunday, joining a series of industrial walkouts around the country, which are hitting supply chains hard. While staff deny the strikes are coordinated, they say the 8% pay rise offered by the port is not enough for a company making millions in profit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's nothing to do with a national strategy or anything like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's something which has happened here at a local level and it reflects what's happening elsewhere because people all over the country, I think, are feeling the same way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That's why it appears to be, you know, perhaps it appears to be coordinated because people everywhere are feeling the same way and coming to the same conclusion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Enough is enough. We are not going to take this anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Located some 150 kilometres northeast of London, the port handles around four million containers a year. While this is almost half of the country's incoming shipping freight, bosses at the port say they believe what they are offering workers is fair. We agree they deserve a fair day's pay for a fair day's work and I think that's what we give them. Britons are facing the worst cost of living crisis in decades as wages fail to keep pace with inflation and grocery costs and utility bill increases. According to the Office of National Statistics, the inflation rate is at a 40 year high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Disturbed beach goers watch on as rescuers carry out a risky operation to save over a dozen swimmers from strong

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: currents in France's coastal town of Biarritz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Eighteen people were dragged out to sea by riptides, with some pulled 800 metres from the shore during the weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Lifeguards and police used jet skis and low-flying helicopters to successfully pull the swimmers out of the water and carry them to safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Local authorities issued the highest alert level along the coastline, which has poplured surfers and holidaymakers as large waves made for treacherous conditions.
